p: From the maxim inhibition zones observed with disc-diffusion method, the MIC values were determined by the microdilution broth assay for Mentha cervina, Ocimum basilicum, and Origanum vulgare ( Table 3). The results of the MIC, MBC, and MFC values against tested Gram-positive, Gram-negative bacteria, and Candida albicans varied from 0.025 to 25 mg/mL and from 0.05 to 50 mg/mL, respectively. Our results suggested that Origanum vulgare EO possessed the highest inhibitory effect against s. aureus with MIC and MBC values of 0.025 and 0.05mg/ml, respectively, followed by EOs of Mentha cervina and Ocimum basilicum.
